AzureContentFilterBlocklistResult.description: A collection of true/false filtering results for configured custom blocklists.

details.description: The pairs of individual blocklist IDs and whether they resulted in a filtering action.

filtered.description: A value indicating whether the blocklist produced a filtering action.

id.description: The ID of the custom blocklist evaluated.

filtered.description: A value indicating whether any of the detailed blocklists resulted in a filtering action.

AzureContentFilterCompletionTextSpan.description: A representation of a span of completion text as used by Azure OpenAI content filter results.

completion_end_offset.description: Offset of the first UTF32 code point which is excluded from the span. This field is always equal to completion_start_offset for empty spans. This field is always larger than completion_start_offset for non-empty spans.

completion_start_offset.description: Offset of the UTF32 code point which begins the span.

details.description: Detailed information about the detected completion text spans.

detected.description: Whether the labeled content category was detected in the content.

filtered.description: Whether the content detection resulted in a content filtering action.

AzureContentFilterCustomTopicResult.description: A collection of true/false filtering results for configured custom topics.

details.description: The pairs of individual topic IDs and whether they are detected.

detected.description: A value indicating whether the topic is detected.

id.description: The ID of the custom topic evaluated.

filtered.description: A value indicating whether any of the detailed topics resulted in a filtering action.

AzureContentFilterDetectionResult.description:
A labeled content filter result item that indicates whether the content was detected and whether the content was
filtered.

detected.description: Whether the labeled content category was detected in the content.

filtered.description: Whether the content detection resulted in a content filtering action.

blocked.description: Indicate if the response is blocked.

content_filter_results.description: A content filter result for a single response item produced by a generative AI system.

source_type.description: The name of the source type of the message.

AzureContentFilterPersonallyIdentifiable.description: A content filter detection result for Personally Identifiable Information that includes harm extensions.

redacted_text.description: The redacted text with PII information removed or masked.

custom_blocklists.description: A collection of binary filtering outcomes for configured custom blocklists.

custom_topics.description: A collection of binary filtering outcomes for configured custom topics.

error.description: If present, details about an error that prevented content filtering from completing its evaluation.

code.description: A distinct, machine-readable code associated with the error.

message.description: A human-readable message associated with the error.

hate.description:
A content filter category that can refer to any content that attacks or uses pejorative or discriminatory
language with reference to a person or identity group based on certain differentiating attributes of these groups
including but not limited to race, ethnicity, nationality, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation,
religion, immigration status, ability status, personal appearance, and body size.

indirect_attack.description:
A detection result that describes attacks on systems powered by Generative AI models that can happen every time
an application processes information that wasn’t directly authored by either the developer of the application or
the user.

jailbreak.description:
A detection result that describes user prompt injection attacks, where malicious users deliberately exploit
system vulnerabilities to elicit unauthorized behavior from the LLM. This could lead to inappropriate content
generation or violations of system-imposed restrictions.

personally_identifiable_information.description: A detection result that describes matches against Personal Identifiable Information with configurable subcategories.

profanity.description:
A detection result that identifies whether crude, vulgar, or otherwise objection language is present in the
content.

protected_material_code.description: A detection result that describes a match against licensed code or other protected source material.

citation.description: If available, the citation details describing the associated license and its location.

URL.description: The URL associated with the license.

license.description: The name or identifier of the license associated with the detection.

detected.description: Whether the labeled content category was detected in the content.

filtered.description: Whether the content detection resulted in a content filtering action.

protected_material_text.description: A detection result that describes a match against text protected under copyright or other status.

self_harm.description:
A content filter category that describes language related to physical actions intended to purposely hurt, injure,
damage one's body or kill oneself.

sexual.description:
A content filter category for language related to anatomical organs and genitals, romantic relationships, acts
portrayed in erotic or affectionate terms, pregnancy, physical sexual acts, including those portrayed as an
assault or a forced sexual violent act against one's will, prostitution, pornography, and abuse.

task_adherence.description: A detection result that indicates if the execution flow still sticks the plan.

violence.description:
A content filter category for language related to physical actions intended to hurt, injure, damage, or kill
someone or something; describes weapons, guns and related entities, such as manufactures, associations,
legislation, and so on.

AzureContentFilterSeverityResult.description:
A labeled content filter result item that indicates whether the content was filtered and what the qualitative
severity level of the content was, as evaluated against content filter configuration for the category.

filtered.description: Whether the content severity resulted in a content filtering action.

severity.description: The labeled severity of the content.

detected.description: Whether the labeled content subcategory was detected in the content.

filtered.description: Whether the content detection resulted in a content filtering action for this subcategory.

redacted.description: Whether the content was redacted for this subcategory.

OpenAI.Annotation.description: An annotation that applies to a span of output text.

OpenAI.ConversationParam.description:
The conversation that this response belongs to. Items from this conversation are prepended to `input_items` for this response request.
Input items and output items from this response are automatically added to this conversation after this response completes.

OpenAI.ConversationParam-2.description: The conversation that this response belongs to.

id.description: The unique ID of the conversation.

OpenAI.ConversationParam-2.title: Conversation object

OpenAI.ConversationReference.description: The conversation that this response belonged to. Input items and output items from this response were automatically added to this conversation.

id.description: The unique ID of the conversation that this response was associated with.

OpenAI.ConversationReference.title: Conversation

dimensions.description: The number of dimensions the resulting output embeddings should have. Only supported in `text-embedding-3` and later models.

encoding_format.description: The format to return the embeddings in. Can be either `float` or [`base64`](https://pypi.org/project/pybase64/).

input.description: Input text to embed, encoded as a string or array of tokens. To embed multiple inputs in a single request, pass an array of strings or array of token arrays. The input must not exceed the max input tokens for the model (8192 tokens for all embedding models), cannot be an empty string, and any array must be 2048 dimensions or less. [Example Python code](https://cookbook.openai.com/examples/how_to_count_tokens_with_tiktoken) for counting tokens. In addition to the per-input token limit, all embedding  models enforce a maximum of 300,000 tokens summed across all inputs in a  single request.

model.description: ID of the model to use. You can use the [List models](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/models/list) API to see all of your available models, or see our [Model overview](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models) for descriptions of them.

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#end-user-ids).

data.description: The list of embeddings generated by the model.

model.description: The name of the model used to generate the embedding.

object.description: The object type, which is always "list".

usage.description: The usage information for the request.

file.description: The File object (not file name) to be uploaded.

purpose.description: The intended purpose of the uploaded file. One of: - `assistants`: Used in the Assistants API - `batch`: Used in the Batch API - `fine-tune`: Used for fine-tuning - `evals`: Used for eval data sets

model.description:
Model ID used to generate the response, like `gpt-4o` or `o3`. OpenAI
  offers a wide range of models with different capabilities, performance
  characteristics, and price points. Refer to the [model guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models)
  to browse and compare available models.

prompt_cache_key.description: Used by OpenAI to cache responses for similar requests to optimize your cache hit rates. Replaces the `user` field. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/prompt-caching).

safety_identifier.description:
A stable identifier used to help detect users of your application that may be violating OpenAI's usage policies.
  The IDs should be a string that uniquely identifies each user. We recommend hashing their username or email address, in order to avoid sending us any identifying information. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#safety-identifiers).

tools.description:
An array of tools the model may call while generating a response. You
can specify which tool to use by setting the `tool_choice` parameter.

The two categories of tools you can provide the model are:

- **Built-in tools**: Tools that are provided by OpenAI that extend the
  model's capabilities, like file search.
- **Function calls (custom tools)**: Functions that are defined by you,
  enabling the model to call your own code.

user.description:
This field is being replaced by `safety_identifier` and `prompt_cache_key`. Use `prompt_cache_key` instead to maintain caching optimizations.
  A stable identifier for your end-users.
  Used to boost cache hit rates by better bucketing similar requests and  to help OpenAI detect and prevent abuse. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#safety-identifiers).

OpenAI.Embedding.description: Represents an embedding vector returned by embedding endpoint.

embedding.description: The embedding vector, which is a list of floats. The length of vector depends on the model as listed in the [embedding guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/embeddings).

index.description: The index of the embedding in the list of embeddings.

object.description: The object type, which is always "embedding".

OpenAI.IncludeEnum.description:
Specify additional output data to include in the model response. Currently supported values are:
- `web_search_call.action.sources`: Include the sources of the web search tool call.
- `code_interpreter_call.outputs`: Includes the outputs of python code execution in code interpreter tool call items.
- `computer_call_output.output.image_url`: Include image urls from the computer call output.
- `file_search_call.results`: Include the search results of the file search tool call.
- `message.input_image.image_url`: Include image urls from the input message.
- `message.output_text.logprobs`: Include logprobs with assistant messages.
- `reasoning.encrypted_content`: Includes an encrypted version of reasoning tokens in reasoning item outputs. This enables reasoning items to be used in multi-turn conversations when using the Responses API statelessly (like when the `store` parameter is set to `false`, or when an organization is enrolled in the zero data retention program).

OpenAI.InputFileContent.description: A file input to the model.

file_data.description: The content of the file to be sent to the model.

file_url.description: The URL of the file to be sent to the model.

filename.description: The name of the file to be sent to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_file`.

OpenAI.InputFileContent.title: Input file

OpenAI.InputImageContent.description: An image input to the model. Learn about [image inputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/vision).

detail.description: The detail level of the image to be sent to the model. One of `high`, `low`, or `auto`. Defaults to `auto`.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_image`.

OpenAI.InputImageContent.title: Input image

OpenAI.InputParam.description:
Text, image, or file inputs to the model, used to generate a response.
Learn more:
- [Text inputs and outputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text)
- [Image inputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/images)
- [File inputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/pdf-files)
- [Conversation state](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/conversation-state)
- [Function calling](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling)

OpenAI.InputTextContent.description: A text input to the model.

text.description: The text input to the model.

type.description: The type of the input item. Always `input_text`.

OpenAI.InputTextContent.title: Input text

OpenAI.ItemResource.description: Content item used to generate a response.

OpenAI.Metadata.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard.
Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings
with a maximum length of 512 characters.

OpenAI.OpenAIFile.description: The `File` object represents a document that has been uploaded to OpenAI.

bytes.description: The size of the file, in bytes.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the file was created.

expires_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the file will expire.

id.description: The file identifier, which can be referenced in the API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always `file`.

purpose.description: The intended purpose of the file. Supported values are `assistants`, `assistants_output`, `batch`, `batch_output`, `fine-tune` and `fine-tune-results`.

status_details.description: Deprecated. For details on why a fine-tuning training file failed validation, see the `error` field on `fine_tuning.job`.

OpenAI.OpenAIFile.title: OpenAIFile

OpenAI.Prompt.description:
Reference to a prompt template and its variables.
[Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text?api-mode=responses#reusable-prompts).

id.description: The unique identifier of the prompt template to use.

OpenAI.Reasoning.description:
**gpt-5 and o-series models only**
Configuration options for
[reasoning models](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning).
OpenAI.Reasoning.title: Reasoning

OpenAI.ReasoningEffort.description:
Constrains effort on reasoning for
[reasoning models](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning).
Currently supported values are `none`, `minimal`, `low`, `medium`, `high`, and `xhigh`. Reducing
reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used
on reasoning in a response.
- `gpt-5.1` defaults to `none`, which does not perform reasoning. The supported reasoning values for `gpt-5.1` are `none`, `low`, `medium`, and `high`. Tool calls are supported for all reasoning values in gpt-5.1.
- All models before `gpt-5.1` default to `medium` reasoning effort, and do not support `none`.
- The `gpt-5-pro` model defaults to (and only supports) `high` reasoning effort.
- `xhigh` is supported for all models after `gpt-5.1-codex-max`.

content_filters.description: The content filter results from RAI.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when this Response was created.

model.description:
Model ID used to generate the response, like `gpt-4o` or `o3`. OpenAI
  offers a wide range of models with different capabilities, performance
  characteristics, and price points. Refer to the [model guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models)
  to browse and compare available models.

object.description: The object type of this resource - always set to `response`.

output.description:
An array of content items generated by the model.
  - The length and order of items in the `output` array is dependent
  on the model's response.
  - Rather than accessing the first item in the `output` array and
  assuming it's an `assistant` message with the content generated by
  the model, you might consider using the `output_text` property where
  supported in SDKs.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow the model to run tool calls in parallel.

prompt_cache_key.description: Used by OpenAI to cache responses for similar requests to optimize your cache hit rates. Replaces the `user` field. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/prompt-caching).

safety_identifier.description:
A stable identifier used to help detect users of your application that may be violating OpenAI's usage policies.
  The IDs should be a string that uniquely identifies each user. We recommend hashing their username or email address, in order to avoid sending us any identifying information. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#safety-identifiers).

status.description:
The status of the response generation. One of `completed`, `failed`,
  `in_progress`, `cancelled`, `queued`, or `incomplete`.

user.description:
This field is being replaced by `safety_identifier` and `prompt_cache_key`. Use `prompt_cache_key` instead to maintain caching optimizations.
  A stable identifier for your end-users.
  Used to boost cache hit rates by better bucketing similar requests and  to help OpenAI detect and prevent abuse. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#safety-identifiers).

OpenAI.ResponseAudioDeltaEvent.description: Emitted when there is a partial audio response.

delta.description: A chunk of Base64 encoded response audio bytes.

sequence_number.description: A sequence number for this chunk of the stream response.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.audio.delta`.

OpenAI.ResponseAudioTranscriptDeltaEvent.description: Emitted when there is a partial transcript of audio.

delta.description: The partial transcript of the audio response.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.audio.transcript.delta`.

OpenAI.ResponseCodeInterpreterCallCodeDe.description: Emitted when a partial code snippet is streamed by the code interpreter.

delta.description: The partial code snippet being streamed by the code interpreter.

item_id.description: The unique identifier of the code interpreter tool call item.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response for which the code is being streamed.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event, used to order streaming events.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.code_interpreter_call_code.delta`.

OpenAI.ResponseCodeInterpreterCallInProg.description: Emitted when a code interpreter call is in progress.

item_id.description: The unique identifier of the code interpreter tool call item.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response for which the code interpreter call is in progress.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event, used to order streaming events.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.code_interpreter_call.in_progress`.

OpenAI.ResponseCodeInterpreterCallInterp.description: Emitted when the code interpreter is actively interpreting the code snippet.

item_id.description: The unique identifier of the code interpreter tool call item.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response for which the code interpreter is interpreting code.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event, used to order streaming events.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.code_interpreter_call.interpreting`.

OpenAI.ResponseContentPartAddedEvent.description: Emitted when a new content part is added.

content_index.description: The index of the content part that was added.

item_id.description: The ID of the output item that the content part was added to.

output_index.description: The index of the output item that the content part was added to.

part.description: The content part that was added.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.content_part.added`.

OpenAI.ResponseCreatedEvent.description: An event that is emitted when a response is created.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number for this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.created`.

x-oaiMeta.example:
{
  "type": "response.created",
  "response": {
    "id": "resp_67ccfcdd16748190a91872c75d38539e09e4d4aac714747c",
    "object": "response",
    "created_at": 1741487325,
    "status": "in_progress",
    "completed_at": null,
    "error": null,
    "incomplete_details": null,
    "instructions": null,
    "max_output_tokens": null,
    "model": "gpt-4o-2024-08-06",
    "output": [],
    "parallel_tool_calls": true,
    "previous_response_id": null,
    "reasoning": {
      "effort": null,
      "summary": null
    },
    "store": true,
    "temperature": 1,
    "text": {
      "format": {
        "type": "text"
      }
    },
    "tool_choice": "auto",
    "tools": [],
    "top_p": 1,
    "truncation": "disabled",
    "usage": null,
    "user": null,
    "metadata": {}
  },
  "sequence_number": 1
}

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.function_call_arguments.delta`.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of the image generation item being processed.

OpenAI.ResponseLogProb.description:
A logprob is the logarithmic probability that the model assigns to producing
a particular token at a given position in the sequence. Less-negative (higher)
logprob values indicate greater model confidence in that token choice.

logprob.description: The log probability of this token.

top_logprobs.description: The log probability of the top 20 most likely tokens.

OpenAI.ResponseMCPCallArgumentsDeltaEven.description: Emitted when there is a delta (partial update) to the arguments of an MCP tool call.

delta.description: A JSON string containing the partial update to the arguments for the MCP tool call.

item_id.description: The unique identifier of the MCP tool call item being processed.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response's output array.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always 'response.mcp_call_arguments.delta'.

OpenAI.ResponseMCPCallArgumentsDeltaEven.title: ResponseMCPCallArgumentsDeltaEvent

item_id.description: The ID of the MCP tool call item that failed.

output_index.description: The index of the output item that failed.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always 'response.mcp_call.failed'.

OpenAI.ResponseMCPCallFailedEvent.title: ResponseMCPCallFailedEvent

OpenAI.ResponseMCPCallInProgressEvent.description: Emitted when an MCP  tool call is in progress.

item_id.description: The unique identifier of the MCP tool call item being processed.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response's output array.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always 'response.mcp_call.in_progress'.

item_id.description: The ID of the MCP tool call item that failed.

output_index.description: The index of the output item that failed.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always 'response.mcp_list_tools.failed'.

OpenAI.ResponseMCPListToolsFailedEvent.title: ResponseMCPListToolsFailedEvent

OpenAI.ResponseMCPListToolsInProgressEve.description: Emitted when the system is in the process of retrieving the list of available MCP tools.

item_id.description: The ID of the MCP tool call item that is being processed.

output_index.description: The index of the output item that is being processed.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always 'response.mcp_list_tools.in_progress'.

OpenAI.ResponseMCPListToolsInProgressEve.title: ResponseMCPListToolsInProgressEvent

OpenAI.ResponseOutputItemAddedEvent.description: Emitted when a new output item is added.

item.description: The output item that was added.

output_index.description: The index of the output item that was added.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.output_item.added`.

OpenAI.ResponseOutputTextAnnotationAdded.description: Emitted when an annotation is added to output text content.

annotation.description: The annotation object being added. (See annotation schema for details.)

annotation_index.description: The index of the annotation within the content part.

content_index.description: The index of the content part within the output item.

item_id.description: The unique identifier of the item to which the annotation is being added.

output_index.description: The index of the output item in the response's output array.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always 'response.output_text.annotation.added'.

OpenAI.ResponseOutputTextAnnotationAdded.title: ResponseOutputTextAnnotationAddedEvent

OpenAI.ResponsePromptVariables.description:
Optional map of values to substitute in for variables in your
prompt. The substitution values can either be strings, or other
Response input types like images or files.
OpenAI.ResponsePromptVariables.title: Prompt Variables

OpenAI.ResponseQueuedEvent.description: Emitted when a response is queued and waiting to be processed.

response.description: The full response object that is queued.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number for this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always 'response.queued'.

OpenAI.ResponseQueuedEvent.title: ResponseQueuedEvent

OpenAI.ResponseReasoningSummaryPartAdded.description: Emitted when a new reasoning summary part is added.

item_id.description: The ID of the item this summary part is associated with.

output_index.description: The index of the output item this summary part is associated with.

part.description: The summary part that was added.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

summary_index.description: The index of the summary part within the reasoning summary.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.reasoning_summary_part.added`.

OpenAI.ResponseReasoningSummaryTextDelta.description: Emitted when a delta is added to a reasoning summary text.

delta.description: The text delta that was added to the summary.

item_id.description: The ID of the item this summary text delta is associated with.

output_index.description: The index of the output item this summary text delta is associated with.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

summary_index.description: The index of the summary part within the reasoning summary.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.reasoning_summary_text.delta`.

x-oaiMeta.example:
{
  "type": "response.reasoning_summary_text.delta",
  "item_id": "rs_6806bfca0b2481918a5748308061a2600d3ce51bdffd5476",
  "output_index": 0,
  "summary_index": 0,
  "delta": "**Responding to a greeting**

The user just said, "Hello!" So, it seems I need to engage. I'll greet them back and offer help since they're looking to chat. I could say something like, "Hello! How can I assist you today?" That feels friendly and open. They didn't ask a specific question, so this approach will work well for starting a conversation. Let's see where it goes from there!",
  "sequence_number": 1
}
x-oaiMeta.name: response.reasoning_summary_text.delta

OpenAI.ResponseReasoningTextDeltaEvent.description: Emitted when a delta is added to a reasoning text.

content_index.description: The index of the reasoning content part this delta is associated with.

delta.description: The text delta that was added to the reasoning content.

item_id.description: The ID of the item this reasoning text delta is associated with.

output_index.description: The index of the output item this reasoning text delta is associated with.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.reasoning_text.delta`.

OpenAI.ResponseRefusalDeltaEvent.description: Emitted when there is a partial refusal text.

content_index.description: The index of the content part that the refusal text is added to.

delta.description: The refusal text that is added.

item_id.description: The ID of the output item that the refusal text is added to.

output_index.description: The index of the output item that the refusal text is added to.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.refusal.delta`.

OpenAI.ResponseStreamOptions.description: Options for streaming responses. Only set this when you set `stream: true`.

include_obfuscation.description:
When true, stream obfuscation will be enabled. Stream obfuscation adds
  random characters to an `obfuscation` field on streaming delta events to
  normalize payload sizes as a mitigation to certain side-channel attacks.
  These obfuscation fields are included by default, but add a small amount
  of overhead to the data stream. You can set `include_obfuscation` to
  false to optimize for bandwidth if you trust the network links between
  your application and the OpenAI API.

OpenAI.ResponseTextDeltaEvent.description: Emitted when there is an additional text delta.

content_index.description: The index of the content part that the text delta was added to.

delta.description: The text delta that was added.

item_id.description: The ID of the output item that the text delta was added to.

logprobs.description: The log probabilities of the tokens in the delta.

output_index.description: The index of the output item that the text delta was added to.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number for this event.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.output_text.delta`.

OpenAI.ResponseTextParam.description:
Configuration options for a text response from the model. Can be plain
text or structured JSON data. Learn more:
- [Text inputs and outputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/text)
- [Structured Outputs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs)

OpenAI.ResponseUsage.description:
Represents token usage details including input tokens, output tokens,
a breakdown of output tokens, and the total tokens used.

input_tokens_details.description: A detailed breakdown of the input tokens.

output_tokens_details.description: A detailed breakdown of the output tokens.

total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens used.

OpenAI.ResponseWebSearchCallInProgressEv.description: Note: web_search is not yet available via Azure OpenAI.

item_id.description: Unique ID for the output item associated with the web search call.

output_index.description: The index of the output item that the web search call is associated with.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of the web search call being processed.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.web_search_call.in_progress`.

OpenAI.ResponseWebSearchCallSearchingEve.description: Note: web_search is not yet available via Azure OpenAI.

item_id.description: Unique ID for the output item associated with the web search call.

output_index.description: The index of the output item that the web search call is associated with.

sequence_number.description: The sequence number of the web search call being processed.

type.description: The type of the event. Always `response.web_search_call.searching`.

OpenAI.TextResponseFormatConfiguration.description:
An object specifying the format that the model must output.
Configuring `{ "type": "json_schema" }` enables Structured Outputs,
which ensures the model will match your supplied JSON schema. Learn more in the
[Structured Outputs guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/structured-outputs).
The default format is `{ "type": "text" }` with no additional options.
*Not recommended for gpt-4o and newer models:**
Setting to `{ "type": "json_object" }` enables the older JSON mode, which
ensures the message the model generates is valid JSON. Using `json_schema`
is preferred for models that support it.

OpenAI.Tool.description: A tool that can be used to generate a response.

OpenAI.ToolChoiceParam.description:
How the model should select which tool (or tools) to use when generating
a response. See the `tools` parameter to see how to specify which tools
the model can call.

OpenAI.ToolsArray.description:
An array of tools the model may call while generating a response. You
can specify which tool to use by setting the `tool_choice` parameter.
We support the following categories of tools:
- **Built-in tools**: Tools that are provided by OpenAI that extend the
model's capabilities, like [web search](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-web-search)
or [file search](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-file-search). Learn more about
[built-in tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools).
- **MCP Tools**: Integrations with third-party systems via custom MCP servers
or predefined connectors such as Google Drive and SharePoint. Learn more about
[MCP Tools](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/tools-connectors-mcp).
- **Function calls (custom tools)**: Functions that are defined by you,
enabling the model to call your own code with strongly typed arguments
and outputs. Learn more about
[function calling](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/function-calling). You can also use
custom tools to call your own code.

OpenAI.Verbosity.description:
Constrains the verbosity of the model's response. Lower values will result in
more concise responses, while higher values will result in more verbose responses.
Currently supported values are `low`, `medium`, and `high`.

bytes.description: The size of the file, in bytes.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) for when the file was created.

purpose.description: The intended purpose of the file. Supported values are `assistants`, `assistants_output`, `batch`, `batch_output`, `fine-tune` and `fine-tune-results`.

content_filters.description: The content filter results from RAI.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when this Response was created.

model.description:
Model ID used to generate the response, like `gpt-4o` or `o3`. OpenAI
  offers a wide range of models with different capabilities, performance
  characteristics, and price points. Refer to the [model guide](https://platform.openai.com/docs/models)
  to browse and compare available models.

object.description: The object type of this resource - always set to `response`.

output.description:
An array of content items generated by the model.
  - The length and order of items in the `output` array is dependent
  on the model's response.
  - Rather than accessing the first item in the `output` array and
  assuming it's an `assistant` message with the content generated by
  the model, you might consider using the `output_text` property where
  supported in SDKs.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow the model to run tool calls in parallel.

prompt_cache_key.description: Used by OpenAI to cache responses for similar requests to optimize your cache hit rates. Replaces the `user` field. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/prompt-caching).

safety_identifier.description:
A stable identifier used to help detect users of your application that may be violating OpenAI's usage policies.
  The IDs should be a string that uniquely identifies each user. We recommend hashing their username or email address, in order to avoid sending us any identifying information. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#safety-identifiers).

status.description:
The status of the response generation. One of `completed`, `failed`,
  `in_progress`, `cancelled`, `queued`, or `incomplete`.

user.description:
This field is being replaced by `safety_identifier` and `prompt_cache_key`. Use `prompt_cache_key` instead to maintain caching optimizations.
  A stable identifier for your end-users.
  Used to boost cache hit rates by better bucketing similar requests and  to help OpenAI detect and prevent abuse. [Learn more](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/safety-best-practices#safety-identifiers).

get.description: Returns a list of input items for a given response.

parameters.description:
The explicit Azure AI Foundry Models API version to use for this request.
`v1` if not otherwise specified.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description:
A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the
default is 20.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description:
Sort order by the `created_at` timestamp of the objects. `asc` for ascending order and`desc`
for descending order.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description:
A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list.
For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your
subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.
parameters.name: after

parameters.description:
A cursor for use in pagination. `before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list.
For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your
subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.
parameters.name: before
